Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2009 02:38PM pattybay wrote: Hi everyone, I can relate to this article too.  I had my mastectomy 3 years ago.  I am also a stroke survivor which occurred in 2003.  After my mastectomy I had tightness and sharp pain around the incision area.  It was even difficult to put a shirt on because the area was very sensitive.  My doctor told me this was something that I would have to live with for now and that it would get better with time--needless to say it didn't get better and I learned to live with it. About a year ago I started receiving acupuncture for problems related to my stroke.  Quite accidentally I also realized that my "post mastectomy" pain was decreasing with weekly acupuncture treatments.  At present time the area is not as sensitive and the pain and tightness is much less.  As a result I am able to move my arm much easier and my shirt goes on with no problem!  I am also happy to say that what physical therapy could not do with my mobility the acupuncture has help with  tremendously as I am able to walk by myself now!  pattybay
